titleStmt.title: Josua M. Daniel et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10147

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To your excelency Beriah Magoffin gov, of Ky Jane Cornitt wife of Hiram Cornitte being fine $5.00 at the office of Elihall Hall J. P. for said county for a veary frivolous thing under the calebar of a breach of the peace by a combine ation of enemies as witness wherein we believe there was but little and probably no offene comitted and said Cornitte is veary poor and entirely peacible never comitting a breach of the peace in his life there fore it is hard he should pay said fine as it would do no body much good and him in his condition considerable harm there fore we pray your exelency to remit said $5.00 fine cessed on the 10th day of July 1860 before said Eli Hall J. P. L. C

Josua M. Daniel
Samuel Cornitte
Wm Cornitt
Samuel Cornite jnr
Joseph Cornitte
Clak Cornitte
Henair Son Chatwine
H Smith
A B Wilson
H Cornitte
J Cornitte
Samuel P Smith
Clabourn Polly
Clark Cornitt Jnr
Henderson Halcom Snr
Danil Halcom
Clark Cornith
Wm Smith
John Halcom
Isaac Day
if hit Should pleas your honor to answer my petition direct your answer to Ambrose Sewell poor harlan county Ky

Letcher J. P.
Jane Cornitte
$5. } breach
Remitted
B. M
Issd Feby 15. 1861
